update.description:
Useful for simulating realistic cameras and also for emulating projectors as cameras (for projection mapping).

Tested in ROS Jade in Ubuntu 14.04.3 (example of projection mapping application https://github.com/inesc-tec-robotics/gazebo_projection_mapping)


Related with:

* https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/pull-requests/2058/added-camera-intrinsics-fx-fy-cx-cy-s
* https://github.com/carlosmccosta/gazebo_ros_pkgs/tree/gazebo-7.0.1-with-camera-intrinsics

pull_request.title: Added camera intrinsics (fx, fy, cx, cy, s).

pullrequest.title: Added camera intrinsics (fx, fy, cx, cy, s).

content.raw:
Good night :)

Initially the goal of these parameters was to model a camera in gazebo using the intrinsic parameters (computed using OpenCV) of a real camera.

Currently, these parameters are for the K matrix of the CameraInfo msg.

I proposed a pull request for supporting them in the gazebo_ros_pkgs

* https://github.com/ros-simulation/gazebo_ros_pkgs/pull/374


The remaining parameters of CameraInfo that could also be useful are the D matrix with the distortion parameters and the ROI.

The ROI is easy to implement (simple image crop), but the distortions cannot be modeled with the OpenGL projection matrix (this was implemented in https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/pull-requests/2058)

For computing the image distortions it could be used:

* http://gazebosim.org/tutorials?tut=camera_distortion
* http://wiki.ros.org/image_proc


What do you think i could add to this PR?

Have a nice day :)
content.html:
Good night :)

Initially the goal of these parameters was to model a camera in gazebo using the intrinsic parameters (computed using OpenCV) of a real camera.

Currently, these parameters are for the K matrix of the CameraInfo msg.

I proposed a pull request for supporting them in the gazebo_ros_pkgs

  • https://github.com/ros-simulation/gazebo_ros_pkgs/pull/374

The remaining parameters of CameraInfo that could also be useful are the D matrix with the distortion parameters and the ROI.

The ROI is easy to implement (simple image crop), but the distortions cannot be modeled with the OpenGL projection matrix (this was implemented in https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/pull-requests/2058)

For computing the image distortions it could be used:

  • http://gazebosim.org/tutorials?tut=camera_distortion
  • http://wiki.ros.org/image_proc

What do you think i could add to this PR?

Have a nice day :)

content.raw:
I added a testing world with a chess board in:
https://github.com/inesc-tec-robotics/gazebo_projection_mapping/blob/hydro-devel/worlds/camera_intrinsics.world

Some images showing the affect of increasing and decreasing each camera intrinsic parameters are available at:
https://github.com/inesc-tec-robotics/gazebo_projection_mapping/tree/hydro-devel/docs/camera_intrinsics

If you need further improvements let me known :)
Have a nice day :)
content.html:
I added a testing world with a chess board in: https://github.com/inesc-tec-robotics/gazebo_projection_mapping/blob/hydro-devel/worlds/camera_intrinsics.world

If you need further improvements let me known :) Have a nice day :)

pull_request.title: Added camera intrinsics (fx, fy, cx, cy, s).

pullrequest.title: Added camera intrinsics (fx, fy, cx, cy, s).

content.raw:
I like the idea of grouping the sdf elements better as you suggested. I agree the WideAngleCamera parameters should belong to its own group as it takes more a computer graphics approach to generating the resulting image. 

So we could end up with:

~~~
<lens>
  <wide_angle></wide_angle>
  <distortion></distortion>
  <intrinsics></intrinsics>  
</lens>
~~~
content.html:
I like the idea of grouping the sdf elements better as you suggested. I agree the WideAngleCamera parameters should belong to its own group as it takes more a computer graphics approach to generating the resulting image.

So we could end up with:

<lens>
  <wide_angle></wide_angle>
  <distortion></distortion>
  <intrinsics></intrinsics>  
</lens>

pull_request.title: Added camera intrinsics (fx, fy, cx, cy, s).

pullrequest.title: Added camera intrinsics (fx, fy, cx, cy, s).

content.raw:
In a true pinhole camera, the [<intrinsics>](http://ksimek.github.io/2013/08/13/intrinsic/) are only dependent on the image sensor characteristics, such as:

* sensor parallel pan in relation to the pinhole (cx,cy)
* sensor distance to the pinhole (fx,fy)
* sensor axis skew (s)

But the lens does affect these parameters (mainly fx,fy).
So i guess the <intrinsics> could be moved inside the <lens> sdf.
In that case, the <distortion> sdf should also be moved inside the <lens> sdf since it does lens distortion.
And since all the parameters inside the current <lens> sdf are used only in [WideAngleCamera.cc](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/src/83d77ddaf32bec720720678d42b755db334c1048/gazebo/rendering/WideAngleCamera.cc?at=default&fileviewer=file-view-default), they probably should be grouped in a element inside the lens, such as <wide_lens> or something similar.


I have tested the <intrinsics> sdf in conjunction with lens distortion simulation using:

* [the <distortion> sdf](http://gazebosim.org/tutorials?tut=camera_distortion)
* [image_proc ros package](http://wiki.ros.org/image_proc)

because i was trying to simulate a "normal" camera lens, and the calibration tools i used were based on [opencv calibration](http://docs.opencv.org/2.4/doc/tutorials/calib3d/camera_calibration/camera_calibration.html), which give the parameters for:

* principal point (cx, cy)
* focal lenghts (fx, fy)
* axis skew (s)
* lens radial distortion (k1,k2,k3)
* lens tangential distortion (p1,p2)


I will do some research to see if the <intrinsics> sdf can be used with the [<lens>](http://gazebosim.org/tutorials?tut=wide_angle_camera&branch=wideanglecamera) sdf ([pr gazebo](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/pull-requests/1866/wideangle-camera/diff), [pr sdf](#!/osrf/sdformat/pull-requests/215/camera-lens-description-replaces-213/diff)).
content.html:
In a true pinhole camera, the <intrinsics> are only dependent on the image sensor characteristics, such as:

  • sensor parallel pan in relation to the pinhole (cx,cy)
  • sensor distance to the pinhole (fx,fy)
  • sensor axis skew (s)

But the lens does affect these parameters (mainly fx,fy). So i guess the <intrinsics> could be moved inside the <lens> sdf. In that case, the <distortion> sdf should also be moved inside the <lens> sdf since it does lens distortion. And since all the parameters inside the current <lens> sdf are used only in WideAngleCamera.cc, they probably should be grouped in a element inside the lens, such as <wide_lens> or something similar.

I have tested the <intrinsics> sdf in conjunction with lens distortion simulation using:

  • the <distortion> sdf
  • image_proc ros package

because i was trying to simulate a "normal" camera lens, and the calibration tools i used were based on opencv calibration, which give the parameters for:

  • principal point (cx, cy)
  • focal lenghts (fx, fy)
  • axis skew (s)
  • lens radial distortion (k1,k2,k3)
  • lens tangential distortion (p1,p2)

I will do some research to see if the <intrinsics> sdf can be used with the <lens> sdf (pr gazebo, pr sdf).

pull_request.title: Added camera intrinsics (fx, fy, cx, cy, s).

pullrequest.title: Added camera intrinsics (fx, fy, cx, cy, s).

content.raw:
After reviewing the code related with the [<lens>](http://gazebosim.org/tutorials?tut=wide_angle_camera&branch=wideanglecamera) sdf ([pr gazebo](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/pull-requests/1866/wideangle-camera/diff), [pr sdf](#!/osrf/sdformat/pull-requests/215/camera-lens-description-replaces-213/diff)), it seems that the [WideAngleCamera.cc](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/src/872c960b330ed6723e36531984eb7895cc83ee4f/gazebo/rendering/WideAngleCamera.cc?at=default&fileviewer=file-view-default#WideAngleCamera.cc-566) creates 6 new cameras using [ogre function OgreSceneManager()->createCamera](http://www.ogre3d.org/docs/api/1.9/class_ogre_1_1_scene_manager.html#a62ca781b4c6d23dc3aab1f3a45d61843) and as such the calls to [setCustomProjectionMatrix](http://www.ogre3d.org/docs/api/1.9/class_ogre_1_1_frustum.html#a0413e366f2b5ecaac7e8a1e27e634def) in the new [Camera.cc](https://bitbucket.org/carlosmccosta/gazebo/src/63c2e15e39b62492ce7f8d661e9186142c9daf61/gazebo/rendering/Camera.cc?at=default&fileviewer=file-view-default) will be ignored.

As such, with the current state of the WideAngleCamera.cc, it seems that the new intrinsics sdf parameters have no visual effect.

But for simulating "normal" cameras, the intrinsics cx,cy,fx,fy,s and deformation parameters k1,k2,k3,p1,p2 might be enough depending on the intended application and lens used.
content.html:
After reviewing the code related with the <lens> sdf (pr gazebo, pr sdf), it seems that the WideAngleCamera.cc creates 6 new cameras using ogre function OgreSceneManager()->createCamera and as such the calls to setCustomProjectionMatrix in the new Camera.cc will be ignored.

As such, with the current state of the WideAngleCamera.cc, it seems that the new intrinsics sdf parameters have no visual effect.

But for simulating "normal" cameras, the intrinsics cx,cy,fx,fy,s and deformation parameters k1,k2,k3,p1,p2 might be enough depending on the intended application and lens used.
